00002  * \file MPFRRandom.hpp

00017 #include <mpfr.h>

00019 /**
00020  * A compile-time assert.  Use C++11 static_assert, if available.
00021  **********************************************************************/
00022 #if !defined(STATIC_ASSERT)
00023 #  if defined(__GXX_EXPERIMENTAL_CXX0X__)
00024 #    define STATIC_ASSERT static_assert
00025 #  elif defined(_MSC_VER) && _MSC_VER >= 1600
00026 #    define STATIC_ASSERT static_assert
00027 #  else
00028 #    define STATIC_ASSERT(cond,reason) \
00029             { enum{ STATIC_ASSERT_ENUM = 1/int(cond) }; }
00030 #  endif

00032 
00033 namespace RandomLib {
00034 
00035   /**
00036    * \brief Handling random numbers in MPFR.
00037    *
00038    * This class provides roughly the same capabilities as RandomNumber.  The
00039    * fraction is represented by a mpz integer f and an exponent e.  We have e
00040    * >= 0 and 0 <= f < b^e, and b = 2^bits.  This represents the number x = f *
00041    * b^-e, with x in [0, 1).
00042    *
00043    * @tparam bits the number of bits in each digit.
00044    *
00045    * \e bits must divide GMP_LIMB_BITS.  The default value \e bits = 32 yields
00046    * portable results on all MPFR platforms.
00047    **********************************************************************/
00048   template<int bits = 32> class MPFRRandom {
00049   private:
00050     static const int limb_ = GMP_LIMB_BITS;  // How many bits in a limb
00051     static const int loglimb_ = (limb_ ==  32 ? 5 :
00052                                  (limb_ ==  64 ? 6 :
00053                                   (limb_ == 128 ? 7 : -1)));
00054     static const int logbits_ = (bits ==   1 ? 0 :
00055                                  (bits ==   2 ? 1 :
00056                                   (bits ==   4 ? 2 :
00057                                    (bits ==   8 ? 3 :
00058                                     (bits ==  16 ? 4 :
00059                                      (bits ==  32 ? 5 :
00060                                       (bits ==  64 ? 6 :
00061                                        (bits == 128 ? 7 :  -1))))))));
00062     static const mp_limb_t mask_ = (bits == limb_ ? ~0UL : // Digit mask
00063                                     ~(~0UL << (bits < limb_ ? bits : 0)));
00064     static const int logw_ = loglimb_ - logbits_; // 2^logw digits per limb
00065     static const unsigned wmask_ = ~(~0U << logw_);
00066 
00067     mutable mpz_t _tt;                                // A temporary
00068     mpz_t _f;                                         // The fraction
00069     mp_size_t _e;                                     // Count of digits
00070     unsigned long _n;                                 // Integer part
00071     int _s;                                           // Sign
00072     void AddDigits(gmp_randstate_t r, long num = 1) { // Add num more digits
00073       if (num <= 0) return;
00074       mpz_mul_2exp(_f, _f, num << logbits_);
00075       mpz_urandomb(_tt, r, num << logbits_);
00076       mpz_add(_f, _f, _tt);
00077       _e += num;
00078     }
00079     // return k'th digit counting k = 0 as most significant
00080     mp_limb_t Digit(gmp_randstate_t r, mp_size_t k) {
00081       ExpandTo(r, k);             // Now e > k
00082       k = _e - 1 - k;             // Reverse k so k = 0 is least significant
00083       // (k >> logw) is the limb index
00084       // (k & wmask) is the digit position within the limb
00085       return mask_ &
00086         (mpz_getlimbn(_f, k >> logw_) >> ((k & wmask_) << logbits_));
00087     }
00088     // Return index [0..32] of highest bit set.  Return 0 if x = 0, 32 is if x
00089     // = ~0.  (From Algorithms for programmers by Joerg Arndt.)
00090     static int highest_bit_idx(unsigned long x) throw() {
00091       if (x == 0) return 0;
00092       int r = 1;
00093       // STILL TO DO: handle 64-bit unsigned longs.q
00094       if (x & 0xffff0000UL) { x >>= 16; r += 16; }
00095       if (x & 0x0000ff00UL) { x >>=  8; r +=  8; }
00096       if (x & 0x000000f0UL) { x >>=  4; r +=  4; }
00097       if (x & 0x0000000cUL) { x >>=  2; r +=  2; }
00098       if (x & 0x00000002UL) {           r +=  1; }
00099       return r;
00100     }
00101   public:
00102     /**
00103      * Initialize the MPFRRandom object.
00104      **********************************************************************/
00105     MPFRRandom() : _e(0u), _n(0u), _s(1) {
00106       STATIC_ASSERT(logbits_ >= 0 && loglimb_ >= 0 && logbits_ <= loglimb_,
00107                     "MPRFRandom: unsupported value for bits");
00108       mpz_init(_f); mpz_init(_tt);
00109     }
00110     /**
00111      * Initialize the MPFRRandom object from another one.
00112      *
00113      * @param[in] t the MPFRRandom to copy.
00114      **********************************************************************/
00115     MPFRRandom(const MPFRRandom& t) : _e(t._e), _n(t._n), _s(t._s)
00116     { mpz_init(_f); mpz_set(_f, t._f); mpz_init(_tt); }
00117     /**
00118      * Destroy the MPFRRandom object.
00119      **********************************************************************/
00120     ~MPFRRandom() { mpz_clear(_f); mpz_clear(_tt); }
00121     /**
00122      * Assignment operator.  (But swapping is typically faster.)
00123      *
00124      * @param[in] t the MPFRRandom to copy.
00125      **********************************************************************/
00126     MPFRRandom& operator=(const MPFRRandom& t) {
00127       _e = t._e;
00128       _n = t._n;
00129       _s = t._s;
00130       mpz_set(_f, t._f);        // Don't copy _tt
00131       return *this;
00132     }
00133     /**
00134      * Swap with another MPFRRandom.  This is a fast way of doing an
00135      * assignment.
00136      *
00137      * @param[in,out] t the MPFRRandom to swap with.
00138      **********************************************************************/
00139     void swap(MPFRRandom& t) throw() {
00140       if (this != &t) {
00141         std::swap(_e, t._e);
00142         std::swap(_n, t._n);
00143         std::swap(_s, t._s);
00144         mpz_swap(_f, t._f);     // Don't swap _tt
00145       }
00146     }
00147     /**
00148      * Reinitialize the MPFRRandom object, setting its value to [0,1].
00149      **********************************************************************/
00150     void Init() { mpz_set_ui(_f, 0u); _e = 0; _n = 0; _s = 1; }
00151     /**
00152      * @return the sign of the MPFRRandom (+/- 1).
00153      **********************************************************************/
00154     int Sign() const throw() { return _s; }
00155     /**
00156      * Change the sign of the MPFRRandom.
00157      **********************************************************************/
00158     void Negate() throw() { _s *= -1; }
00159     /**
00160      * @return the floor of the MPFRRandom
00161      **********************************************************************/
00162     long Floor() const throw() { return _s > 0 ? long(_n) : -1 - long(_n); }
00163     /**
00164      * @return the ceiling of the MPFRRandom
00165      **********************************************************************/
00166     long Ceiling() const throw() { return _s > 0 ? 1 + long(_n) : -long(_n); }
00167     /**
00168      * @return the unsigned integer component of the MPFRRandom.
00169      **********************************************************************/
00170     unsigned long UInteger() const throw() { return _n; }
00171     /**
00172      * @return the number of digits in fraction
00173      **********************************************************************/
00174     unsigned long Size() const throw() { return unsigned(_e); }
00175     /**
00176      * Add integer \e k to the MPRFRandom.
00177      *
00178      * @param[in] k the integer to add.
00179      **********************************************************************/
00180     void AddInteger(long k) {
00181       k += Floor();             // The new floor
00182       int ns = k < 0 ? -1 : 1;  // The new sign
00183       if (ns != _s) {           // If sign changes, set f = 1 - f
00184         mpz_set_ui(_tt, 1u);
00185         mpz_mul_2exp(_tt, _tt, _e << logbits_);
00186         mpz_sub_ui(_tt, _tt, 1u);
00187         mpz_sub(_f, _tt, _f);
00188         _s = ns;
00189       }
00190       _n = ns > 0 ? k : -(k + 1);
00191     }
00192     /**
00193      * Compare with another MPFRRandom, *this < \e t.
00194      *
00195      * @param[in,out] r a random generator.
00196      * @param[in,out] t a MPFRRandom to compare.
00197      * @return true if *this < \e t.
00198      **********************************************************************/
00199     int LessThan(gmp_randstate_t r, MPFRRandom& t) {
00200       if (this == &t) return false; // same object
00201       if (_s != t._s) return _s < t._s;
00202       if (_n != t._n) return (_s < 0) ^ (_n < t._n);
00203       for (mp_size_t k = 0; ; ++k) {
00204         mp_limb_t x = Digit(r, k);
00205         mp_limb_t y = t.Digit(r, k);
00206         if (x != y) return (_s < 0) ^ (x < y);
00207       }
00208     }
00209     /**
00210      * Set high bit of fraction to 1.
00211      *
00212      * @param[in,out] r a random generator.
00213      **********************************************************************/
00214     void SetHighBit(gmp_randstate_t r) { // Set the msb to 1
00215       ExpandTo(r, 0);               // Generate msb if necessary
00216       mpz_setbit(_f, (_e << logbits_)  - 1);
00217     }
00218     /**
00219      * Test high bit of fraction.
00220      *
00221      * @param[in,out] r a random generator.
00222      **********************************************************************/
00223     int TestHighBit(gmp_randstate_t r) { // test the msb of f
00224       ExpandTo(r, 0);               // Generate msb if necessary
00225       return mpz_tstbit(_f, (_e << logbits_)  - 1);
00226     }
00227     /**
00228      * Return the position of the most significant bit in the MPFRRandom.
00229      *
00230      * @param[in,out] r a random generator.
00231      *
00232      * The bit position is numbered such the 1/2 bit is 0, the 1/4 bit is -1,
00233      * etc.
00234      **********************************************************************/
00235     mp_size_t LeadingBit(gmp_randstate_t r) {
00236       if (_n) return highest_bit_idx(_n);
00237       while (true) {
00238         int sgn = mpz_sgn(_f);
00239         if (sgn != 0)
00240           return mp_size_t(mpz_sizeinbase(_f, 2)) - mp_size_t(_e << logbits_);
00241         AddDigits(r);
00242       }
00243     }
00244     /**
00245      * Ensure that the k'th digit of the fraction is computed.
00246      *
00247      * @param[in,out] r a random generator.
00248      * @param[in] k the digit number (0 is the most significant, 1 is the next
00249      *   most significant, etc.
00250      **********************************************************************/
00251     void ExpandTo(gmp_randstate_t r, mp_size_t k)
00252     { if (_e <= k) AddDigits(r, k - _e + 1); }
00253     /**
00254      * Convert to a MPFR number \e without adding more bits.
00255      *
00256      * @param[out] val the value of s * (n + *this).
00257      * @param[in] round the rounding direction.
00258      * @return the MPFR ternary result (+1/-1 if val is larger/smaller than the
00259      *   exact sample).
00260      *
00261      * If round is MPFR_RNDN, then the rounded midpoint of the interval
00262      * represented by the MPFRRandom is returned.  Otherwise it is the rounded
00263      * lower or upper bound of the interval (whichever is appropriate).
00264      **********************************************************************/
00265     int operator()(mpfr_t val, mpfr_rnd_t round)
00266     { return operator()(val, NULL, round); }
00267     /**
00268      * Convert to a MPFR number.
00269      *
00270      * @param[out] val the value of s * (n + *this).
00271      * @param[in,out] r a GMP random generator.
00272      * @param[in] round the rounding direction.
00273      * @return the MPFR ternary result (+1/-1 if val is larger/smaller than the
00274      *   exact sample).
00275      *
00276      * If \e r is NULL, then no additional random bits are generated and the
00277      * lower bound, midpoint, or upper bound of the MPFRRandom interval is
00278      * returned, depending on the value of \e round.
00279      **********************************************************************/
00280     int operator()(mpfr_t val, gmp_randstate_t r, mpfr_rnd_t round) {
00281       // The value is constructed as a positive quantity, so adjust rounding
00282       // mode to account for this.
00283       switch (round) {
00284       case MPFR_RNDD:
00285       case MPFR_RNDU:
00286       case MPFR_RNDN:
00287         break;
00288       case MPFR_RNDZ:
00289         round = _s < 0 ? MPFR_RNDU : MPFR_RNDD;
00290         break;
00291       case MPFR_RNDA:
00292         round = _s < 0 ? MPFR_RNDD : MPFR_RNDU;
00293         break;
00294       default:
00295         round = MPFR_RNDN;      // New rounding modes are variants of N
00296         break;
00297       } // Now round is one of MPFR_RND{D,N,U}
00298 
00299       mp_size_t excess;
00300       mpfr_exp_t expt;
00301       if (r == NULL) {
00302         // If r is NULL then all the bits currently generated are considered
00303         // significant.  Thus no excess bits need to be squeezed out.
00304         excess = 0;
00305         // And the exponent shift in mpfr_set_z_2exp is just...
00306         expt = -(_e << logbits_);
00307         // However, if rounding to nearest, we need to make room for the
00308         // midpoint bit.
00309         if (round == MPFR_RNDN) {
00310           excess = -1;
00311           --expt;
00312         }
00313       } else {                  // r is non-NULL
00314         // Generate enough digits, i.e., enough to generate prec significant
00315         // figures for RNDD and RNDU; for RNDN we need to generate an
00316         // additional guard bit.
00317         mp_size_t lead = LeadingBit(r);
00318         mpfr_prec_t prec = mpfr_get_prec (val);
00319         mp_size_t trail = lead - prec; // position one past trailing bit
00320         mp_size_t guard = trail + (round == MPFR_RNDN ? 0 : 1); // guard bit pos
00321         // Generate the bits needed.
00322         if (guard <= 0) ExpandTo(r, (-guard) >> logbits_);
00323         // Unless bits = 1, the generation process will typically have
00324         // generated too many bits.  We figure out how many, but leaving room
00325         // for one additional "inexact" bit.  The inexact bit is set to 1 in
00326         // order to force MPFR to treat the result as inexact, to break RNDN
00327         // ties, and to get the ternary value set correctly.
00328         //
00329         // expt is the exponent used when forming the number using
00330         // mpfr_set_z_2exp.  Without the inexact bit, it's (guard - 1).
00331         // Subtract 1 to account for the inexact bit.
00332         expt = guard - 2;
00333         // The number of excess bits is now the difference between the number
00334         // of bits in the fraction (e << logbits) and -expt.  Note that this
00335         // may be -1 (meaning we'll need to shift the number left to
00336         // accommodate the inexact bit).
00337         excess = (_e << logbits_) + expt;
00338       }
00339       mpz_set_ui(_tt, _n);                    // The integer part
00340       mpz_mul_2exp(_tt, _tt, _e << logbits_); // Shift to allow for fraction
00341       mpz_add(_tt, _tt, _f);                  // Add fraction
00342       if (excess > 0)
00343         mpz_tdiv_q_2exp(_tt, _tt, excess);
00344       else if (excess < 0)
00345         mpz_mul_2exp(_tt, _tt, -excess);
00346       if (r || round == MPFR_RNDN)
00347         // Set the inexact bit (or compute the midpoint if r is NULL).
00348         mpz_setbit(_tt, 0);
00349       else if (round == MPFR_RNDU)
00350         // If r is NULL, compute the upper bound. 
00351         mpz_add_ui(_tt, _tt, 1u);
00352 
00353       // Convert to a mpfr number.  If r is specified, then there are
00354       // sufficient bits in tt that the result is inexact and that (in the case
00355       // of RNDN) there are no ties.
00356       int flag = mpfr_set_z_2exp(val, _tt, expt, round);
00357       if (_s < 0) {
00358         mpfr_neg (val, val, MPFR_RNDN);
00359         flag = -flag;
00360       }
00361       return flag;
00362     }
00363     /**
00364      * A coin toss.  (This should really be a static function.  But it uses the
00365      * MPFRRandom temporary variable.)
00366      *
00367      * @param[in,out] r a GMP random generator.
00368      * @return true or false.
00369      **********************************************************************/
00370     int Boolean(gmp_randstate_t r) const {
00371       mpz_urandomb(_tt, r, 1);
00372       return mpz_tstbit(_tt, 0);
00373     }
00374   };
00375 
00376 } // namespace RandomLib

00378 #endif  // RANDOMLIB_MPFRRANDOM_HPP
